channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Cynthia Lummis, a One-Term G.O.P. Senator, Will Not Seek Re-election
item.description: A conservative who has served in the Senate since 2021, Ms. Lummis attributed the decision to the “difficult, exhausting session” this fall on Capitol...

item.title: OpenAI vs. Apple? Sam Altman is setting his sights on winning what could be an even higher-stakes AI battle
item.description: Altman recruited iPhone designer Jony Ive to OpenAI this May, and Ive has said the company’s secret device could be ready in the next two years.

item.title: U.S. Strikes on Syria Underscore Scale of Challenge for Its President
item.description: The Syrian government did not comment directly on the extensive American strikes targeting the Islamic State on Friday, but said it was intensifying i...

item.title: Instead of Trump’s ‘A+++++’ economy, even the chamber of commerce in this swing-state city admits it’s not robust
item.description: Only 31% of U.S. adults now approve of how Trump is handling the economy, down from 40% in March, according to a poll from The Associated Press-NORC C...

item.title: U.S. Coast Guard Boards Tanker Carrying Venezuelan Oil
item.description: The vessel, which was flying a Panamanian flag, was not on a list of tankers under U.S. sanctions.

item.title: U.S. forces attack Islamic State targets in Syria in ‘a declaration of vengeance’ for ambush that killed Americans
item.description: U.S. Central Command said in a social media post that American jets, helicopters and artillery employed more than 100 precision munitions on Syrian ta...

item.title: Koch Political Operation Spent Nearly $550 Million During 2024 Cycle
item.description: The huge sum shows that while the Koch network may not hold significant power at high levels of the Republican Party, it remains a financial juggernau...

item.title: A photo with Trump in it appears to have been removed from the partial Epstein files the Justice Department released
item.description: "This photo, file 468, from the Epstein files that includes Donald Trump has apparently now been removed from the DOJ release."

item.title: How the ‘Reddit Detective Agency’ and surveillance technology helped find the suspect in the deadly Brown University shooting
item.description: A local Reddit user "blew this case right open” with an old-fashioned tip first posted on the social media platform.

item.title: 6 Takeaways From the First Batch of the Epstein Files
item.description: Many of the Justice Department documents were heavily redacted, and President Trump’s name was rarely mentioned. The White House also sought to make p...

item.title: Taiwan’s Subway Stabber Planned His Deadly Spree, Police Say
item.description: Investigators said they were unsure of the attacker’s motives. But clues pointed to an isolated and increasingly troubled life, and no accomplices.

item.title: Sudanese Refugees Describe Their Escape From Darfur
item.description: No one knows the true toll of the massacre, and the city remains isolated. Now, refugee camps in Chad are flooded with newly displaced Sudanese.

item.title: With Attacks on Oil Tankers, Ukraine Takes Aim at Russia’s War Financing
item.description: Strikes on four vessels signal that Kyiv is willing to expand the maritime theater of the conflict in an effort to crimp Moscow’s military funding.

item.title: U.S. Strikes on Syria Underscore Scale of Challenge for Its President

item.title: Land Grab: Inside Israel’s Escalating Campaign for Control of the West Bank
item.description: Israeli seizure of Palestinian lands in the West Bank, often brutally, has accelerated, raising doubts about the prospects of a peaceful solution to t...
